div.p: Greetings. I have received all your letters and everything else, and I give great thanks for all of these.

When I received your last letter, in which you mentioned that the castle of Ramüs was burned and that the honorable consul Martin asked me to inform our consul, I immediately went to the consul. He had already received letters on the same matter and was preparing to present the entire issue to the senate.
I went straight to the inn "Ciconiae," where I heard your envoy, Mr. Johannes von Capaul, was staying, who was said to have returned from Baden in the evening.
As you instructed, I explained the entire matter to him. He was shocked; I reassured him.

Soon a senator came from the senate, who reported to him that it had already been decreed in the senate that the received letters should be sent to Baden to the consul; for the Swiss envoys are still here and will only leave tomorrow. Otherwise, haste will be necessary.
Furthermore, in the name of all the Swiss, envoys from Zürich, Lucerne, Schwyz, and Glarus will go to Rhaetia. I had a friendly conversation with the noble von Capaul; he praised you greatly, etc.

The booklet he is compiling is not yet fully prepared; otherwise, I would now send it to the bishop; but better late than poorly done. I am sorry to hear that the castle, which I hear was elegant, was burned.

Let us hope we do not soon hear that those madmen have devastated other places! They want to start a new peasant war. May the Lord grant us peace! Apart from what I wrote eight days ago, I have received nothing from friends. Farewell.
Greet the most honorable envoy and the consuls most kindly.
Do not forget to send the wine to my honorable mayor.

I have read your letter; he thanks you sincerely, and for your convenience, you should prepare. First, ensure that you are avenged without delay, then that he is not harmed on the journey here; my lord Tscharner can help you with that, so that it is done in such a way that no one can interfere. 1565. Bullinger.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, faithful pastor of the Church of Chur, my esteemed and beloved lord and brother.
